description: Construction of a three storey building to accommodate 18 self-contained flats (7 x one-bed and 11 x two-bed) , with associated access, car parking, cycle storage, amenity space and landscaping (Regulation 3- Development by London Borough of Ealing)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings:

Exisitng Site Location Plan - A_BA2-S03-DR_0001 Rev A; Exisitng Site Plan - A-BA2-S02-DR-0002 Rev D; Proposed Site Plan - A-BA2-S02-DR-0100 Rev G; Proposed Ground and First Floor Plan - A-BA2-S02-DR-0101 Rev A; Proposed Second Floor and Roof Plan - A-BA2-S02-DR-0102; Existing and Proposed Elevations - A_BA2-S02-DR_0200; Proposed Floor Plans - A_BA2-S02-DR_0300 Rev D and A_BA2-S02-DR - 0301 Rev E; Proposed Block Elevations - A_BA2-S02-DR_0310; Proposed Block Elevations and Sections - A_BA2-S02-DR_0311; Proposed Landscape Plan - L-BA2-S02-DR-0900 Rev C; and Proposed Improvements to Pedestrian Access - EAL-EGS-HTA-L_BAZ-S02-SK-160414.

Affordable Housing Statement (prepared by JLL); Arboricultural Impact Assessment - (prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd, 27th January 2016, 56156v4); Daylight, Sunlight and Overshadowing Analysis - (prepared by HTA, 21/12/2015, EAL-EGS Batch 2); Design and Access Statement - (prepared by HTA, EAL-EGS_BA2_S42-RP 0001 Rev D); Energy Report and Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment - (prepared by HTA, 21 December 2015, EAL-EGS_R_BA2-S02-RP_0002); Geo-Environmental Report - (prepared by Enzygo Ltd, CRM.1027.021.GE.R.001.C); Planning Statement (prepared by JLL, Janyrary 2016); Statement of Community Involvement (SCI) - (prepared by JLL, January 2016); Transport Statement - (prepared by Transport Planning Associates).
Reason:  In the interests of accuracy and proper planning.

| Sound insulation and noise control measures for the approved residential dwellings shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets described at Section 4(B) 'Criteria for adequate protection for new buildings' of Ealing's interim SPG 10:
Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast)
Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq
Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq
The sound insulation and noise control measures shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the flats and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the amenity of the residential occupiers of the new development, in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.18 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016; Policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The development hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve compliance with the commitments set out within the Design and Access Statement in relation to 10% of dwellings meeting part M4 (3) (Wheelchair User Dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015.

Reason: To ensure that the new dwellings are adaptable, accessible and flexible in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8, 3.9 of the London Plan (2016) and Policy 1 (h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| Prior to the commencement of works (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works), the following detailed information shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:

a) An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site, carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance, to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person and shall assess any contamination on the site.

b) A contamination remediation scheme to bring the relevant parts of the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. The scope of the remediation scheme shall include details of all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, a timetable of works and site management procedures.  The remediation scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.
c) Details of mitigation measures to control the release of asbestos fibers in accordance with Control of Asbestos Regulations 2012.

Within six-months of the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme, a verification report (in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1') that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason: Further investigations of the presence of soil contamination within the application site and details of the methods for remediation are required before the commencement of building works in order to ensure that human health and the environment are protected, and to ensure the development activities do not activate or spread contamination in accordance with policies LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), Policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| No development shall commence until tree protection measures set out within the approved Arboricultural Impact Assessment 56156v4 (27/01/2016) prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd, in accordance with BS 5837:2012 'Trees in Relation to Design, Demolition and Construction' and outlined in Proposed Landscape Plan drawing L-BA2-S02-DR-0900 Rev C are put in place.  The tree protection measures shall be retained throughout the demolition of existing buildings and construction of the approved development, in accordance with the recommendations in BS5837 (2012).

The tree protection measures shall be retained until the development has been completed.  The areas enclosed by the tree protection measures shall not be used for any storage and the levels within these areas shall not be altered.  The trees which are proposed for removal shall be replaced in the next planting season following the completion of works on-site.
Reason: The protection of trees and other vegetation is required in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.

| The facing materials of the building hereby approved shall be provided in accordance with the details and materials legend within the approved Design and Access Statement (EAL-EGS_BA2_S42-RP 0001 Rev-D, 21/01/2016) prepared HTA Design LLP and indicated on the approved drawings; unless alternative samples of materials are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials are of a high-quality specification and make a positive contribution to the street scene, in accordance with Policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1 (h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012) and policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to the development hereby approved being brought into use, full details of the number, design and location of Electric Vehicle Charging Points within the designated car parking area shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority.  The details shall include provision for 20% of the parking spaces equipped with Active Electric Charging and 20% of the parking spaces equipped with Passive Electric Charging for later adaption.  The development shall be implemented on-site in the approved manner and made available prior to its first use.
REASON: In accordance with Policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and Policy 1.2 (k) of Ealing Core Development Strategy (2012).

| The secure and sheltered bicycle storage indicated on drawing ref: A-BA2-S02-DR-0100 Rev G shall be provided before the first occupation of the development.  The approved facilities shall be maintained for such purpose thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure that satisfactory provision is made for the safe storage of bicycles, in accordance with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016) and Ealing's adopted Sustainable Transport for New Development SPD.

| The approved dwellings shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 36.1% (equal to at least 8.15 tonnes CO2 per annum) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement (11 December 2015) prepared by HTA Design LLP and including:
a)	energy saving measures to achieve at least 4.7% (equal to 1.06 tonnesCO2 per annum) in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline.

b)	incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 15.84kWp to achieve at least a percentage of 33% (equal to 7.1 tonnes C02 per annum) in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Lean case.

Within three-months of the first occupation of the new dwellings, the Energy Performance Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and SAP modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Notwithstanding the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement prepared by HTA Design LLP (11/12/2015), prior to commencement of the development, dynamic thermal modelling using the guidance provided in CIBSE TM49 should be used to assess the proposed dwellings and evidence/results for how the development performs against its overheating criteria or even exceeds the overheating CISBE TM49 guidance standards should be submitted to the Local Authority for written approval.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with Policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012) and Development Management DPD (2013).
| Prior to works commencing onsite, detailed drainage designs shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate the following:

a) the proposed SUDs attenuation facility would be designed to limit the maximum discharge to 5l/s for all storms up to and including the 1 in 100 year return period plus allowance for climate change.
b) the proposed building incorporates a suitable freeboard above the final external ground level to mitigate against the risk of surface water flooding in an extreme rainfall event.
c) details of the type of control device to be used to control the discharge of surface water from the development and design/specification.
The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved drainage details and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Policy 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of the London Plan (2016).
site_number: Former Garage Site adjacent to Perceval Court
